titles.title: A bill for the relief of the Pottawatomi Nation in Canada for the proportionate share of tribal funds and annuities under treaties between the Pottawatomi Nation and the United States, and for other purposes.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S6863-6865)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to Subcommittee on Courts and Administrative Practice.

bill.summary: 6/14/1994--Introduced. Directs the Secretary of the Treasury to pay the Pottawatomi Nation in Canada for their proportionate share of the tribal funds and annuities, plus interest, that arise under treaties between them and the United States that, but for the residence of the Nation in Canada and outside U.S. territorial limits, would have been compensable under the Indian Claims Commission Act.
